dialogues.text: (picking up the pace) Mom and I fought for 20 minutes over whether we should go with ecru invitations or brilliant white.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty checks her stop watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ecru.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then the gold scroll or the black Romanesque print?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty completely stops and faces Ruth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do we have to talk wedding details?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no, of course not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, you can always send me fabric samples to look at or pictures of dresses. But, it's been so long since we've seen each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. You're right. Besides, we should be talking about your engagement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They start walking again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me more about Beast beating up that other cat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bloody furry mess, like I said. (beat) Aren't you so excited about Paul? (beat) Letty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruth stops this time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on with you, Letty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruthie, do you ever wonder if you'll meet someone else...someone besides Jake?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Power walking's forgotten.   Ruth and Letty start to ambl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's his name, Letty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't say...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't even try.    What's his name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nurse Gates passes by the open door, and pokes her head i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lights out, Letty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty closes the door. She pulls a nightshirt from a draw disrupting a perfectly-folded T-shirt. Letty bends down t straighten it, but changes her mind. She shuts the drawer Letty puts on the nightshirt, crawls into bed and snaps o the light. She fluffs her pillow, and turns over. She rol back. Letty turns on the light. She goes to the drawer, opens i pulls out the T-shirt and refolds it. She shuts the drawe Letty yanks open the drawer again and looks at her handiw It's a fight with the drawer. Opened and closed. Until Le takes a deep breath, pulls it open a final time, hesitant ruffles the T-shirt and slams the drawer shut. She runs to bed and hops in, turning off the light and burying her head under the pillow. A few moments pass. A KNOCK on the door. Letty opens it to find Michael.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're supposed to be asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael takes Letty's hand and pulls her toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll get caught.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No rounds for another three hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael checks the hallway and pulls Letty into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nervous? Scared? Worried you're not fit for a caper of epic proportions?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be ridiculous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rendezvous at the closet in 30.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty forges ahead to the nurses' station, while Michael turns a corner in the hall, peeking out so he can watch L approach Nurse Gates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty, you should be in bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a spider in my room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's got a green dot on its back. I can't go to sleep with it watching me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds awful. I guess we better check it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty and Nurse Gates walk down the hall to Letty's room, passing the alcove where Michael lurks in the shadows. He sneaks into the main hall and pads up to the nurses' stat

dialogues.speaker: NURSES' STATION
dialogues.text: Michael wanders around the desk, crouches on the floor so can't be seen from the hallway and pulls the phone down t his level. He dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Extra large pepperoni and mushrooms. (beat) And two cokes. (beat) Hillview Psychiatric Hospital on Glenfield. Off the Fourth Street exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael reaches up to a hook and grabs a white lab coat. puts on the coat, which identifies him as "Val Williams."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty and Nurse Gates, sprawled on their stomachs, peer u the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It had this red spot on its back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Green spot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mottled really.   Green and red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nurse Gates looks Letty squarely in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know why you feel you have to lie, Letty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you feel lonely, or need to talk, all you have to do is say so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To talk? (beat) Well, OK, that might be good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand you just got engaged. Maybe that's where we should start.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off Letty's look of dismay, we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael pays the DOMINO'S PIZZA MAN and tries to walk pas the guard, JIM, who blocks his path.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid I can't let you take that in without the proper invoice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a pizza.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the same, rules are rules.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't understand. This is a very important, very special, morale-boosting pizza.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I understand is how low morale gets when you're posted at a guard station all night, Val.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reluctantly, Michael opens the pizza box, and Jim helps himself to two slices. Michael starts to shut the box. Ji reaches in for a third slice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty and Nurse Gates sit cross-legged on the bed, facing each other. Letty's face is puffy from crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't mean to go on and on like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's OK.   It's good to let it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael passes the open door with the pizza box and point down the hall. Letty stares right through him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you ever tell Paul how you felt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was graduating from law school, and he just assumed I was OK with dropping out. (beat) We never really talked about it. But I know he was disappointed in me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The roomy closet houses an inconceivable number of white sheets and towels, arranged on wide, tall shelves. The pizza, cokes and a candle sit in the middle of the fl which Michael has draped with a sheet. Michael stares at dwindling candle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean I'm just not sure I want the same things now that I did even a month ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nurse Gates nods sympathetically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that so wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael passes the open door again, waving his hands wild to attract Letty's attention. She doesn't notice him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can only do what feels best to you now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess so. I think that's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael blows out the candle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty blows her nose as she walks Nurse Gates to the door

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been so great. I just feel a lot clearer about things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if I need to talk again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, of course. Whenever you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty gives Nurse Gates a hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TAPS on the door. Michael looks up. He jumps to his feet and lets Letty in, gesturing for her to sit. They lean against a stack of pillows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry I'm late...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael puts his finger to Letty's lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh.

dialogues.speaker: A SERIES OF SHOTS THAT FADE INTO EACH OTHER
dialogues.text: A.) The two munch on pizza. Michael picks off black olive and hands them to Letty, who plops them on top of her piz B.) Michael hands Letty a cigarette. She gestures no. lights one for himself and begins blowing smoke rings. C.) Michael offers Letty pizza.     She clutches her stom show that she's full. D.) Letty indicates she wants a cigarette. Michael demonstrates how to smoke, affecting the style of a 1930s movie star. Letty follows suit. E.) Letty grabs a pillow and hits Michael over the head. pulls the pillow away from her. Letty stands up, grabs another pillow and hits Michael again. He whacks her in t back of the knees and she falls on top of him. Enough of the fighting.    They kiss.   Michael strokes t of Letty's neck. FOOTSTEPS approach the door and stop. Michael and Letty s kissing and look at the door. The FOOTSTEPS continue on. Michael pulls Letty's shirt up. She starts to pull it ove her head, but can't get it all the way off in the cramped space. Michael kisses Letty's mouth through the shirt. Sh GIGGLES. Michael helps Letty off with the shirt. He kisses her chest.    Letty bites him lightly on the shoulder. Michael pulls away in surprise, grinning. Letty reaches u and bites him again. Michael bites her back. Letty reaches her hands behind her head, searching for something to hold onto. She grabs a stack of sheets, whic topple onto Michael. Michael sits up, trying to clear the sheets off himself a Letty. Letty pushes him down and crawls on top of him. CLOSE ON her hands as they unbutton Michael's Levis, and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Hallstrom sits close to the television, watching Joa Rivers hawk jewelry on the Home Shopping Network. Michael drapes the room with streamers, and surveys his work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's it look?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh. They're coming to the cubic zirconium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like those sapphire earrings myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simulated sapphires. I bet my daughter would love those, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael sees Letty pass by the room as she heads down the hall. He follows her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marie enters with her toothbrush and toothpaste.   She mo towards the sink but stops as... GIGGLES come from the stall. She looks closer, sees two pairs of feet and one familiar pair of boxers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus...just get a room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marie walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty and Michael, partially disrobed and hugging each ot tight, burst into GUFFAWS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty sits on the couch.   Emlee leans forward in his cha

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's a problem that you never told me about Michael. I had to hear it from another patient.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't really say anything because of that fraternizing rule.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Letty, this does present a liability issue for the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a grown woman, Dr. Emlee.   I can take care of myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Michael? Do you know the extent of his...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know Michael's a schizophrenic, and Mrs. Hallstrom's manic- depressive, and John Lockyer has episodes of psychosis, and I heard a rumor that you suffer from delusions of grandeur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead and put the guard back up, Letty. But you need to know what you're dealing with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't need a lecture.   I care about Michael.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then that's even more reason to listen. Look, schizophrenics tend to withdraw from reality. They experience emotional disturbances that result in personality changes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. EMLEE(cont'd) (beat) You could be lying next to Michael in bed one night, and he could have a hallucination, or a delusion. It might happen when you're driving or...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I know he's almost through with treatment here. And, he's on medication.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drugs can help suppress symptoms. But lots of patients stop taking them when they're on their own because the side effects are so harsh. (beat) And, Michael's condition is often worsened by periods of stress. He's been in and out of...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to hear anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like you to promise you won't carry on a relationship with Michael. Otherwise, I'll consider moving one of you to another ward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First you tell me to do what I want to, then you tell me to stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I want you to do is think about what's best for you. Really think about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty lies in the middle of a copse of trees, reading Emi Dickinson. Michael walks up and hands her a dandelion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A daisy for the lady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lady knows this is a dandelion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A rose is a rose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty kisses him on the cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.    Where've you been all day?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back-to-back sessions with the shrink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds important.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not allowed to see you anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?    Me too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had to sneak by the guards to get here. They say you're highly unstable, have a depressive personality, and may hold back my own recovery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow.    I'm bad news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's my rap?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Schizophrenic recidivism marked by hallucinations and paranoid delusions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck.    That's all true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really, though. My thoughts go haywire sometimes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are the delusions like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think people are after me, crap like that. (beat) When I was 18, my mom came home and found me sitting naked on the kitchen table. I thought I was God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He waits for Letty to register the information.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shocking, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. But I took out a whole grocery store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I could have seen that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm starting to think that everyone's crazy to some extent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My Grandma Rosa says that some trees get planted in rich top soil, and they grow right up to the sun, tall and straight. Other trees, they start as seeds in the crevices between rocks so they have to twist and bend to reach the light. (beat) But even though they end up crooked, they're still trees, just like the straight ones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lying on their backs, Michael and Letty stare up at the leaves overhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a start) Why in the world did you let me start talking in metaphors? That's no way for us to break up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Break up?    They wish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael and Letty hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nurse Gates pours tablets from a potpourri of pill bottle into little paper cups. A Federal Express delivery man wi a bunch of boxes stops at the station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need a signature, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nurse Gates looks at the form.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is all this stuff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just deliver it, Ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, who exactly is it for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Mrs. Eunice Hallstrom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see. Can you wait a moment?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nurse Gates locks the medication in a cupboard, and hurri down the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our usual cast of characters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But how does that make you feel, John, what Letty said about your hostility?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't know what the hell she's talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nurse Gates barrels in.   The group looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Doctor. I just need a moment with Mrs. Hallstrom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What seems to be the problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They say she ordered...Mrs. Hallstrom, did you order a bunch of stuff, because Federal Express...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Hallstrom's face glows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's here, everyone. Come along. It's here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She runs out. Nurse Gates follows her. A moment passes. patients look expectantly at Dr. Emlee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, fine, let's see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They storm the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the time the patients round the corner, the Federal Express man is leaving, and Mrs. Hallstrom has ripped ope one of the boxes. She clutches a handful of jewelry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For you, John. And, Letty. And, Michael, I know you'll love these.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hands Michael a pair of faux sapphire earrings. He cl them on. Letty and several others carry necklaces. Thomas sports a rhinestone tiara. The patients compare jewelry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Hallstrom, you ordered all this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Mrs. Hallstrom) Thomas got a crown and all I got was a lousy bracelet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must have spent thousands of dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, Doctor, I didn't forget you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Hallstrom hands Dr. Emlee a fake ruby hair comb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Hallstrom, you can't possibly afford to pay for this. It must go back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chatter in the hallway stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, no, Doctor. It can't. Most of it's for my daughter, Lily. She's coming to family day tomorrow...all the way from Cleveland with my grandson. (beat) You can't be taking away their "Welcome to California" presents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's going back. We'll contact the company this afternoon. (to patients) Take the jewelry off, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The patients reluctantly remove their gifts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I have to keep something for my daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go back to group, and discuss it there. Back to group, everyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The patients head back to group.   Dr. Emlee turns to Nur Gates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Nurse Gates) Increase her lithium to 600 milligrams, three times a day. Oh, and Nurse, let's see about canceling the cable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place buzzes with festivity. A "WELCOME FAMILIES" sig hangs from a patio beam. A table is laden with cookies an lemonade and platter after platter of carrot curls. Letty takes a cookie and looks toward the lawn where Mich plays frisbee with his family, even his grandmother, ROSA Nurse Gates walks up to Letty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your mother's in the rec room, Letty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty passes Mrs. Hallstrom, who sits by herself, holding small gift on her lap. Letty spots her Mom across the room, and walks up to her. Her mother has covered a table with swatches of fabric.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's so good to see you, Sweetheart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You too, Mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're looking good.    A little thin, but good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty examines a fabric sample.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks so much for doing this. Ruthie and Jake are up to a million things. And I just can't decide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty rearranges the fabric samples on the table by color

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which flowers did you order?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We haven't. I wanted to talk that over with you, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, OK, well, better to choose the table cloths first anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was thinking either the peach moire or cream damask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty holds up a swatch of bright yellow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This would complement the blue in the bride's maids' dresses. Look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's your ring, Sweetheart?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We aren't allowed to wear jewelry in here, Mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just think, pretty soon, we'll be doing all these wedding preparations for you. (beat) Of course, if that's what you still want. Ruthie told me some silly story about a crush on some boy here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty pulls out a cigarette, lights it and starts smoking

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't had a crush since I was

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When did you start smoking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll put it out if it bothers you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The puckering, dear. It doesn't seem so now, but in time, it will cause wrinkles around the mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty grinds the cigarette beneath her heel.    She bends the fabrics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, your life isn't about being in a mental hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hear this Michael fellow is schizophrenic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't forget that Paul's a promising young attorney who loves you very much...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, look, if I want to dump Paul, I'll dump him. If I want to screw Michael or live with him or marry him, then I'll do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thomas, who sits across the room, looks up from his book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering) I'm only looking out for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling) And if I want to smoke, I'll fucking smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty races out the door and into the garden. In the distance, Michael spots her and jogs over. Letty's mother watches them. Thomas approaches Mrs. Mayer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Mayer, I'm sorry but I couldn't help overhearing. I just wanted to say, not that it's any of my business...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think, really, I think I'd go with the cream damask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty and Michael walk through the rec room toward the di hall. Nurse Gates bends down in front of Mrs. Hallstrom, sits where we last saw her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's OK to be upset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gaily) Upset? Why of course not. My goodness, no. I'm sure she just got hung up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty and Michael stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Hallstrom, why don't you join my family for dinner. You'll love my Grandma Rosa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's so sweet, Michael. But, really, I've so many things to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you change your mind, we'll be in the dining hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael and Letty walk on, exchanging a sad look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Santucci and Mrs. Santucci sit at the heads of the ta Letty sits between Rosa and Michael.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Letty) What do you need now? (to Mr. Santucci) Send down the lamb. This girl's as thin as a stick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no.   I'm stuffed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell her to eat, Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mangia.   Mangia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering to Letty) You can't turn down Grandma Rosa's lamb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or my eggplant. I make the best eggplant in L.A. The mozzarella I use, it's so fresh it sweats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty heaps more food on her plate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael says you're a teacher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was. I'm hoping I'll still have a job when I get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Hallstrom walks into the room, wearing her Christmas stocking cap. She starts to dispense erasers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's she doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Hallstrom, practically skipping, zeros in on Grandma Rosa. She hands Rosa the gift meant for her daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosa, Rosa, you must have this, Rosa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grazie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Hallstrom, join us. Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, by this point, Mrs. Hallstrom's already bounded away divesting herself of more and more erasers to bewildered parents and delighted children. She clambers onto a table in the middle of the room. Mari gets up from another table and leaves the room to get hel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merry Christmas to all. Ho, ho, ho, ho.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael, we've got to stop her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael pushes back his chair.   He's trapped between the table and the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My goodness, it's so very warm in here. So warm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes off her cap and tosses it to a surprised lookin man. But she doesn't stop there. With haphazard abandon, begins to disrobe, first her blouse, then her skirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Way, way, way too warm for December. Now, let's sing Jingle Bells, Jingle Bells, Jingle all the way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group looks on in horror, mesmerized by her behavior. Then, almost as one, the patients spring into action. Michael bolts over his dining table and runs to Mrs. Hallstrom. He jumps onto her table, trying to restrain th dancing woman so he can wrap his sweater around her. By this time, John, Thomas and Letty have surrounded her protective enclave. Michael sets Mrs. Hallstrom on the ground. She looks up at the group, and continues belting "Jingle Bells."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty and Michael lie on the floor next to each other, trading puffs on a cigarette. The glowing ember is the on light in the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must have thought about it. Everyone does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want to see Beast. (beat) Where would you go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mission up in Santa Barbara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's where I always go when I get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My dad used to take me there when I was little. It's totally quiet. And you can see the ocean for miles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They smoke for a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What else would you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to drink a bottle of red wine with you and then make love to you and spend the whole night together. And we'd get up in the morning and spend hours lounging around and reading the paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we'd eat Spaghetti-O's in bed from the can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can you even mention Spaghetti- O's after eating Grandma Rosa's dinner tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a terrible confession.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell the doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like lamb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael sits up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then it's over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lie down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael lies down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a good thing my family loves you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your family just met me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right. I guess I was projecting. What I should have said is, "It's a good thing I love you."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael, I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's OK. You don't have to say anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I do.     I love you, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael and Letty lie still, looking into each others eye

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Posters of Harry Houdini and Doug Henning.       Handcuff card decks all over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Honor, I feel I should be released. I'm sufficiently able to look after...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael stops. His eyes glaze over.        His head darts the corner of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the corner) What? What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing's there.   Nothing at all.    But Michael keeps s A KNOCK on the door. Michael's eyes refocus.       He ope door to find Letty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John and Nurse Gates are waiting for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, right.     I'm ready.   How do I look?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (straightening his tie) Great. I came to tell you to break a leg, and to give you this for good luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty hands him the Cracker Jack ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael sits near the front of the courtroom with half a dozen other patients from various institutions. Nurse Gates sits a few rows back near JOHN'S MOTHER and Michael's family--Mr. and Mrs. Santucci and Grandma Rosa. JUDGE MILTON, 60s, questions John, who's on the stand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why have you petitioned to leave the institution?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't had an episode in more than a month, Sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you plan to support yourself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My family's helping me out, Your Honor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where will you live upon release?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Live?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John's mother nods encouragingly at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do you plan to reside, Mr. Lockyer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With my mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is your mother here today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John points to her.   John's mother waves at the judge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the bitch. That cock- sucking bitch. She put me here. She did. She's the Satan that did this all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As bailiffs remove John from the stand, Michael offers a smile to his family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael, outwardly poised and collected, sits on the stan His hands are clenched in tight fists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The records indicate no major episodes in the past four months. And it seems you have the support of the staff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I see you've been in and out of the hospital more than ten times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eleven, Your Honor.   But I'm on a new medication now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you feel ready to re-enter the world?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Sir. My family is    prepared to support me until I find   a job. They've already located   an apartment for me that's   very near them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very well, then. By order of the court, you are released. I wish you good luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael's shoulders relax. He opens his fist. Inside is t Cracker Jack ring, and the magenta circle it has imprinte his palm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael walks to the car with his mother, father and grandmother, who keeps tousling his hair with pride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty stands awkwardly in front of Paul, who sits in a wingback chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's so urgent?   You've got me worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to tell you something, and I'm not sure how.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can tell me anything. (beat) Do you want to postpone the wedding? Is it too much pressure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a load off my mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul, I want to break off the engagement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't mean to hurt you.    I know this is a terrible thing.    And I have really loved you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa. Whoa. Have really loved me? Letty, it's natural to be nervous. But we're going to work through our problems.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've met someone else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter who.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you been seeing another teacher?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a doctor, isn't it? That's unethical. I'll have him rung up on malpractice charges so fast his head will spin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a patient here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul considers this a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of all the crazy things. I understood when you dropped out of law school. And during this whole mess, I've tried to be supportive. But, really, Letty, what can you be thinking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to throw away our life together for some shared experience with a looney-tune that you misguidedly think is love?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's the ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way. You keep the ring.     You'll come to your senses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've made my decision, Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You keep it, Letty. This is not over. Our life is not over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul walks out the door and down the steps past Michael, runs up them two at a time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's it hanging, Paul?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul turns to watch Michael as Michael swings open the do and sails into the institute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty waits as a NURSE opens the door to the ward.   Lett about to step through, when Michael enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Visitor for Ms. Mayer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty whirls around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Home free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty and Michael hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty, Michael, you have about five minutes until visiting hours end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The nurse retreats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was brilliant, or at least boringly sane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So there were no problems?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And did you go to the mission?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you goof, I came to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just checking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw Paul leaving.    Did you do the dirty deed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, it's over?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All over. (beat) Did you see your new apartment?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One bedroom, second floor, no view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Furnished?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I need some serious household advice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First off, you'll need to go to Target. And, let's see, what should you buy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I better make a list.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: List schmist. You'll remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty sits in the corridor opposite Marie and Thomas.   T are playing BLACKJACK. Letty deals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hit me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty hands one over.    Thomas flips over his cards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty looks to Marie, who waves her off. Marie is fine wi her cards. They look down the hall. Nurse Gates walks bes JAMIE, a man in his late 20s, who wears the same dazed expression Letty did the morning after she was admitted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jamie) Dr. Stone will ask you some questions, and then we'll get you settled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nurse Gates and Jamie come upon the gang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Letty/Bill) Lights out in 15, Guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nurse Gates continues down the hall, hand firmly planted under Jamie's elbow as he weaves unsteadily beside her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, that first night is hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's going to be a difficult few weeks for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It really makes you think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It really does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look down the hall at the retreating figures.   They at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll put in 5 that it's a straight diagnosis of depressive personality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you kidding? With those glazed eyes? I'm willing to bet 10 there was some break with reality going on there. Psychosis. Without a doubt, psychosis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty is curled up in a chair opposite Dr. Emlee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what I really can't believe is that I'm starting to actually miss work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you been in contact with the principal about your job?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought about calling, but I want to wait until I know when I'll be out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, you should call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's about that time, Letty. The charges against you have been dropped, the drugs have evened out and you seem to be dealing with your life quite well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you saying I'm through with therapy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's not be hasty. (beat) I'm saying we should plan a release date for early next week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off Letty's excited face, we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crowds, crowds and more crowds. Michael pulls unsuccessfu at a shopping cart that is stuck to another. A MATRONLY WOMAN walks up, nudges Michael out of the way yanks the cart out of its row. She rolls it toward Michae grabs one for herself and is on her way into the store. Michael takes several deep breaths. With trepidation in h step, he heads into the great unknown of the crowded stor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael emerges from the store, quite pleased with himsel that he made it out alive. He commands a cart heaped full useless gadgets and trinkets, a half dozen picture frames about 20 decorative pillows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty and her mother walk briskly through the gardens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must you walk so quickly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's good exercise, Mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got 26 years on you. If we could just slow down, we could talk so much easier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty slackens her pace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so thankful you'll be leaving next week. If you want me to pick you up, I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've already made arrangements.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruthie mentioned that Michael might be coming for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty stops and wags her finger at her mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, we agreed. You can visit, but you're not allowed to mention Michael.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not even if it's something positive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nyet.   That's the condition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother and daughter keep walking in silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you spoken to Paul at all?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One more and you're out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honestly, Letty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A deal's a deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two walk on in silence. Silence. More silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you heard the figure on how much Queen Elizabeth's going to pay in taxes this year?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty stops walking. She turns a sunny smile on her mothe then hugs her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew you had it in you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty neatly folds garments and lays them in a suitcase. Emlee looks on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, we'll meet every Tuesday and Friday. And if you have any kind of emergency, you can page me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, good. That's good. Thanks an awful lot for everything, and for coming down here to see me off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was just a little going-away gesture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a going-away gesture for you, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty puts her hand in her suitcase and rummages through clothes, creating a jumbled mess. She snaps the luggage closed. Bits of clothing hang out. They LAUGH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty sets her duffel bag down next to two suitcases. She hugs Marie, John, Thomas, then walks over to Mrs. Hallstr who hangs back from the group. Letty embraces her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll miss you, Mrs. Hallstrom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no response.    Letty goes to Nurse Gates and hug

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take care, Letty. And, let me know if you need help with any spiders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know I will.       Thanks for everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty walks toward Michael, who gathers up her bags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you later, guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael and Letty walk through the VISITING ROOM...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you supposed to throw a bouquet or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you ever quiet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk out the doors onto the FRONT STEPS OF THE HOSPI Michael grabs Letty's hand as they hurry down the steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've heard the mission in Santa Barbara is the place to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the background, the Spanish-style mission blends into hillside. Letty and Michael sit on a bluff, holding hands They look out at the ocean, where the sun heads toward th waves in a fiery red glow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael and Letty walk down the hall. Michael stops at a and showcases it. He jingles the keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is it -- 3B.     Check it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open up.    I want to see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close your eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty claps her hands over her eyes.    Michael opens the and guides her into his castle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK.    Open them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty surveys the territory. Forget tables, chairs and couches. Throw pillows are strewn everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty picks up a pillow and runs her hand over the fabric She pauses a moment before speaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love the pillows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Throw pillows, Letty. The sales lady said they're the latest thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very trendy. Let's see the rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael leads Letty to the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A futon bed, draped with a mosquito net, rests in the cor Two TVs take center stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's TV heaven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was tired of watching what everyone else wants to watch. Now we can watch two shows at once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's try out the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael grabs her hand and pulls her toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got to see the kitchen first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you like it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love your apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll never get rid of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael kisses Letty on the lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you say we go out to dinner to celebrate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out? Are you kidding?     I've got all the fixings here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off Letty's look of surprise, we watch Michael open a cupboard door. The shelves are filled from top to bottom with cans of Spaghetti-O's. Letty squeezes Michael in a bear hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty, in a T-shirt, and Michael, in boxers, lounge on th futon. They watch both TVs -- one tuned-in to Jay Leno, t other to David Letterman. Michael eats from a can of Spaghetti-O's. Letty reaches o with her fork and snags a mouthful from Michael's can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can you not like the Top 10 List?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like it.     But Headlines are better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're so wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty takes her remote and increases the volume on her TV As Letterman gets louder, Michael zaps his volume. It's a war. Letterman then Leno get LOUDER and LOUDER and LOUDER until Letty makes a might lunge. She wrests Michae remote from him. Letty MUTES both TVs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's sex time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael mockingly checks his watch.    Letty climbs on to him. Michael rolls on top of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's my turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE on their faces as Michael gently licks the side of Letty's mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I get spaghetti sauce on my face?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael licks Letty's nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhhh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael and Letty look into each other's eyes, bathed in blue light thrown off by the twin televisions. Michael places a pillow gently beneath Letty's head.    H caresses her face. Letty's eyes are alive to every look, every touch. Michae kisses her slowly on the forehead, the nose, and the lips CLOSE on Letty's hands as she reaches up to stroke Michae forehead and caress his temple. CLOSER on her hands as Letty runs them through Michael's hair, then twists a curly lock around her finger. SOFT MOANS as we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE on Letty's hand, resting on the comforter on Michae bed. The alarm clock RINGS. Letty's hand slaps it into submission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty's still in bed, a look of bliss across her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty?   Rise and shine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael's face fills her vision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty's eyes close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be forced to tickle you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty opens one eye and glares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about this? It's 10:30.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty bolts upright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm supposed to meet the principal in half an hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see you tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael gives her a kiss and walks into the LIVING ROOM. Michael adjusts his tie. Letty, naked, runs into the room and throws her arms around his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You, too. Kick ass today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael walks out the door. Letty thinks for a minute. Sh flings open the door and yells to Michael's retreating ba

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My apartment tonight.   You can meet Beast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael swings around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds good. Oh, and Letty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling) You've got one hell of a great body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door across the hall opens. A LITTLE OLD MAN stares a Letty's naked figure. She slams Michael's apartment door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty collapses in GIGGLES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty sits across from the principal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't have any choice but to include the parents' letters in your file.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I understand.     I know my behavior was poor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, in light of how the parents feel, and the fact the students are doing so well with the substitute, I don't think I can put you back in the classroom just yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Gail, I've been a good teacher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, Letty. But the incident with Zach was frightening for the children. (beat) Now if you'd come to me, explained what was going on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Believe me, I wish I'd understood what was going on. I've worked really hard to get better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad you're doing well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've already thought about how to tell the kids where I was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty hands the principal a letter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'd like to send the parents this letter of explanation. With your support, I think they can accept me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The principal reads the letter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a very nice letter. But I have to go with what's best for the students.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need someone to work on budget projections.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Office work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or, of course, you could take a sabbatical the rest of the year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael sits at a back desk with MR. SMYTHE, who wears a three-piece pin-striped suit and taps a pencil on his kne

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not that we're doubting your intelligence, Mr. Santucci. But your work history shows so many interruptions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, but as I said...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I appreciate your candor about your illness, but my bosses are concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can do the job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Between you and me, my uncle, he has some mental problems, and I know what you're going through. If it were up to me, I'd hire you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael's already standing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.   Thanks for your help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shakes Mr. Smythe's hand, and, downcast, gets out of t bank as quickly as he can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty sits on the floor. She gulps down some aspirin, the hauls Beast into her lap. The doorbell RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael walks in, and looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gosh, Letty, this is a great place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kisses her, and lies down on the floor to stroke the c

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This must be Beast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Mr. Beast to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How was your day?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bombed. It's either work in the office or nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds grim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.    How was the job search?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael makes a thumbs-down gesture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who ever said sanity was fun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter.    It'll work out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Promise?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Promise. (beat) As long as we have steak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steak?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a well-known fact that a red- meat dinner can cure the blues. (beat) You and Beast wait here. I'll be back in a jiff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty gives Michael a tired smile. Michael jumps up and leaves. A moment passes. The door opens again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While I'm gone why don't you slip into something a little more naked?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael walks out of the grocery store, loaded down with bags. He carries a bottle of wine and a bunch of flowers. He passes two ladies who gossip outside the store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe he did that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a weirdo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael stops abruptly.   He turns back and looks at the women. They LAUGH. Michael starts toward the car. He hears more LAUGHTER fro the women. He turns back and walks up to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't ever talk about me again, you hear me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The women pull back in fright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty, in a skimpy negligee, lights candles on the table. Michael enters with the groceries and wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought maybe you got lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The store was busy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got wine. That's great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you mind if we just called it an early night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You go ahead and relax. I'll cook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I should go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you OK?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big restaurant interview tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what about the red meat-blues thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, we've got that dinner with my parents tomorrow, too. I should really get some rest tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael gives Letty a kiss good night. He leaves. She stares after him. Reluctantly, she blows out the candles starts putting the groceries away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Beast) How's filet sound?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The coffee shop hasn't opened for business yet. Michael a six people in their early 20s fill out applications. Michael stares blankly at his application.    He fills ou name. He can't get any further. TWO OTHER APPLICANTS glance toward him.   Michael tries t write. He can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under his breath) No, no, no. Not now. No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other applicants look toward Michael and quickly aver their eyes. The RESTAURANT MANAGER walks up to the group. Michael grabs his briefcase and walks out of the restaura His application, incomplete, remains on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This kitchen is the heart of the home--copper pots, two p makers and every size wooden spoon made. Letty, lightly dusted with flour, mixes fresh pasta with hands. Mrs. Santucci peers into the bowl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More water. It's too pasty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty pours in more water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll never Mget the hang of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the Santucci women go through this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty smiles at her and kneads harder.   Mr. Santucci ent and kisses his wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi there, Letty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Santucci looks in the pasta bowl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It needs more water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He dumps some in.   Letty looks sadly at the gloppy mess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Mrs. Santucci) Maybe we should make lamb next week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael walks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Sweetheart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd it go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael takes his tie, holds it up like a noose and lets tongue loll out of his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four interviews. Four no-gos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The restaurant, too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't even face that one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. and Mrs. Santucci look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's OK. We can call and reschedule in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to take care of me, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An uneasy silence falls in the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we should save the job talk for after dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael looks in the bowl of pasta dough that Letty conti to labor over. He reaches in to help with the mixing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Letty) Just promise you'll love me even if I end up in a job where I have to wear a blue polyester cap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you know I'd love you even more in a blue polyester cap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael finishes brushing his teeth. He opens the medicin cabinet, pulls out a prescription bottle and pours a pill into his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to miss the Top Ten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He raises the pill to his mouth, then opens his hand and it drop in the sink. Michael runs the water and watches t pill swirl slowly down the drain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael, hurry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael stuffs the pill bottle in a bottom drawer. He ope the door, sprints into the bedroom and leaps onto Letty, lies on the futon. Letty SCREAMS and LAUGHS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael sits in a booth drinking coffee. He bows over an application, pen in hand. About a third is filled out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty and Superintendent Johansen sit on the floor, which covered with math games, posters and charts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I could get the program up and running in the next two weeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From what I understand the principal has removed you from student activities.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's worried that I'm unstable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johansen studies her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I wouldn't push for the program if I wasn't ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the office work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd have to do that, too. But I've gotten better at pacing myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll call you if I have problems. Scout's honor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to say I'm inclined to give it another try.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty hugs Johansen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, Letty, why don't you give yourself three weeks to set it up this time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael sits in the same booth, eating a hamburger.   Abo half of the application is now completed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty and her mother sit in silence. Letty smiles at her mother. Her mother gives her a very tiny smile back. Michael hurries in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Letty. Mrs. Mayer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got worried. Are you OK?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael pulls a blue polyester hat out of his pocket and it on.               M

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How may I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael, the shop's about to close. Maybe you could try on your tux.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael heads to the dressing room in the back of the sto

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Mrs. Mayer) Michael just got a job.    Couldn't you congratulate him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will, Dear. I promise. (beat) Why McDonald's?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's been looking everywhere for weeks, Mom.   It's not that easy after you've been locked away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty looks toward the back of the store.    Her mother l at her. Letty ignores her mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've read that lots of people my age are supplementing their incomes these days by working at McDonald's and Burger King.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty looks at her mother, tries to read her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to take that as an honest effort at being open minded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be fresh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just remember that I love him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael walks out of the dressing room and advances towar the two women, bowing in Cary Grant fashion as he nears. Letty's mother turns to her daughter, who beams brightly the dashing Michael.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Letty) I'll say this, Dear.   He looks damn good in a tuxedo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty and Michael jog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aunt Lily is the one who married your father's cousin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that's Aunt Connie. Lily is the one who looks like a hooker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. And, Harry, he's the one who likes magic?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to know all this by Saturday. It took me years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every inch of every pew in the Baroque church is stuffed guests. Michael sits in the second row. He cranes his hea around as "Pachelbel's Canon" RINGS OUT and the FLOWER GI advances. Letty, in the first part of the bride's maids' procession heads down the aisle next. The bride is nowhere in sight. But even so, as soon as Michael spots Letty, he stands. Everyone else remains seated. They look at him. Michael doesn't notice. He has eyes only for Letty. Letty's mother looks at Michael with more than annoyance. Begrudgingly, she also stands. Following the lead, the entire church stands for Letty. smiles at Michael.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A parade of guests pass through the receiving line to gre Mr. Mayer, Monica, Letty, Mrs. Mayer, Ruth and Jake. Michael hovers close to Letty. AUNT LILY, with fluorescen red hair and a silver lame miniskirt, spots him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Michael) What a beautiful wedding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she passes out of earshot,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Letty) Aunt Lily?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bingo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Mayer talks to her brother CORT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, and have you met Michael?    He's Letty's boyfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty and Ruth overhear this. They make eye contact.   Ru raises her eyebrows toward Letty. Letty smiles back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruth and Letty talk while Michael twirls across the dance floor with Monica.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The worst was when I stammered Jake's name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think people even noticed. I thought the ceremony was perfect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's thanks to all your help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cort, overweight and red from drink, approaches Ruth and Letty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh oh, Uncle Cort at 6 o'clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry to do this to you. But I am the bride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruth turns and flees. CORT pounces on Letty and plants th wettest kiss ever on her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Letty) I don't think I've seen you in two or three years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has it been that long?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were with that lawyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm dating Michael now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Met him in the receiving line. What is it that he does for a living?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael walks up to Letty and Cort as they speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, he just got a job...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the restaurant business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty looks at Michael, surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speak of the devil. (beat) How did you guys meet again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the psych hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would've sent a card, but your aunt and I, we weren't sure if that was the thing to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's fine, Uncle Cort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Michael) So you were a volunteer over at the hospital?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When he could get time off from the restaurant business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Letty) How about a dance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You two go ahead. I'm going to go bother that pretty sister of yours for a dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cort gives Letty another big, wet kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye, Uncle Cort. (to Michael) What's with the lie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't exactly a lie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People at weddings don't want the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael grabs a glass of champagne from a passing waiter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not good to drink so much with the medication you're on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's with this music? I'll go talk to the D.J. and see if we can't get something good going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael heads toward the D.J. and confers with him.    Mr Mayer walks up to Letty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's good to see you so happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael then walks back to Letty and pulls her out onto t dance floor as "Twist and Shout" BOOMS OUT from the speak Letty's mother departs the dance floor, grimacing. Ruth shoots Michael a look of pure pleasure. And everyone begi twisting, as we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Completely dark.   Silent. Letty, in a nightshirt, wanders in, and stumbles through room. She fumbles for the switch on the floor lamp. The light comes on, illuminating a small circle.    Just outside of it sits Michael. He stares straight ahead.    Letty kneels down in front o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael? (beat) Michael? You should come to bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael remains focused on the space directly in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you take the aspirin and water? You don't want to feel awful in the morning. (beat) I'll get you some.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty begins to stand up. The movement breaks Michael's trance. He pulls her back down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it? Are you OK?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (strangely calm) Always the drugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw you talking to my Mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We both talked to her, Michael. And your dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd you tell her I wasn't taking my meds?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean not taking your meds?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd you tell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't talk to her about medications, Michael. Don't be silly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael beats his hand on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silly?   Silly am I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael, take it easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silly, silly, silly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I should call someone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael reaches out, grabs the floor lamp, and pushes it over. He lurches to his feet and pulls Letty to a standin position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming) Don't upset my Mom.     Don't you upset my Mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael, calm down. Please. It's OK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael knocks some flowers over, then rips apart a pillo Letty hovers in back of him.     He pauses.   She puts he on his back. Michael whirls around.   He slaps Letty's hand away. She stumbles backward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael, stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stares in her direction, but he doesn't respond. can't make a connection. Michael shoves his fist through a window. Letty grabs the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not my Mom. Not my silly silly Mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty runs with the phone. Michael follows her. Letty trips. She rights herself. She locks herself in the bathr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael POUNDS on the bathroom door.     Letty dials 9-1-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got an emergency.    I'm at...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael HOWLS -- a long, piercing inhuman sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1450 North Jenkins. Apartment 2. My boyfriend's out of control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the other side of the door, Michael SCREAMS.    Anothe window SHATTERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on in there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Please, please, send someone. (beat) No, he's having an attack. He's schizophrenic...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty, wearing Michael's tux jacket, is curled up on the floor in a fetal position. She stares...at the upset flowers, at the ripped-up pillo at a fist-sized hole ripped through an unsturdy wall. Her gaze stops on a Spaghetti-O's can, lying empty on the flo KNOCKS on the door.   Letty rises slowly, padding to the like an old woman. The KNOCKS grow urgent.   Letty opens the door to Ruth. Letty throws herself into Ruth's waiting embrace. Immediately, Letty cries. After a moment, Letty steps back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, so sorry.   I never should have called.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruth looks into Letty's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did the right thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ruined your wedding night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad you called. Now, not another word about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
