dialogues.text: Ruth pulls Letty into the apartment and shuts the door be them. It is only then that she sees the destruction in th living room. Horror flashes across her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tears stream down Letty's face.   Ruth starts to cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he hurt you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty shakes her head "no." Her sobbing intensifies. Ruth puts her arm around Letty, and together, they sit on the floor. Ruth holds Letty until the crying eases.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Ruthie, what am I going to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to make any decisions tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what am I going to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want to go see him? I'll take you if you want to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't.    I can't see him there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruth holds her close again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was so sure. I really thought it would work. (beat) We have plans, Ruth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.    I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty sits on the same bluff she once shared with Michael She smokes a cigarette, and stares out at the ocean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty remains on the bluff, crying. A priest, passing in background looks over at her, and continues on his way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the darkness, Letty lies on her back. She stares up at the moon and stars, bright against the night sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty walks along a pathway with Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad you agreed to see me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just glad there aren't any hard feelings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, none. None. I completely understand what was going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's work going?    Are you back at school?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I start on Monday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So things are back on track?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Getting back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard about your friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard your friend was back in the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael.   Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wondered, well, if this meant there was a chance for us. Because I think about you a lot, and I still feel...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our relationship meant a lot to me, too, Paul. But it's over. (beat) And Michael being in the hospital doesn't really change things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I've heard this speech before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm really sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty reaches up to hug him.    He quickly disengages him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got a deposition that I really need to get cracking on, so if you don't mind...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, I understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul starts down the path.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. Wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty runs up to Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to give you this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty hands Paul the engagement ring. He takes it and continues walking as she stares after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty walks up the steps to the imposing facility. We fol her journey through the VISITING ROOM, past families conversing with patients, to the NURSES' STATION. Letty walks up to Nurse Gates, who gives her a quick hug. John and Bill watch as Letty signs the visitors' register

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's in Jamie's old room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty walks down the HALLWAY and pauses outside Michael's door. She KNOCKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael is in the middle of taping up the same Houdini po we saw in his last room when Letty enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty and Michael kiss awkwardly.    Dead silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They smile nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess we need to talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's hard to know where to start.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretend like I'm your shrink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty rolls her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.   I'll be quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think about you all the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sure know what that feels like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And all the plans we have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, the plans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty looks out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been thinking I could try to visit you at night after work, and then there'd be more time on weekends to see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like I've told you before I don't want you taking care of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone has to take care of you right now, Michael. You tore up the apartment. You stopped taking your medications.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that wasn't me.    I didn't mean to do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well then why'd it happen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I don't fucking know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty and Michael glare at each other.    Letty looks awa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.     I didn't come here to blame you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't mean for any of this to happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God, Michael, I know. (softly) Why does everything have to be so hard?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we going to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know I don't want to lose you.     I don't think I could stand it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but can you stand to be with me like this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty waits. She looks away. She turns back and stares in Michael's eyes. Finally, she says it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I can't, Michael. I'm so sorry, but I just can't handle all this right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty starts to cry.   Tears well up in Michael's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.   I can't either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael sits down on the bed and they hold each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you so much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you too, Letty.     I love you, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty and Michael grip each other.    Finally, they pull

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we could just run away to Tahiti and live on the beach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the best idea I've heard in a long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty wipes a tear from Michael's cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you have a magic trick or something to make this easier?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about something better?   Like a kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The couple kisses more tenderly than ever before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can still come visit you, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would that really be such a good idea for either of us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just promise me you'll be OK, OK?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will. And you make sure you take care of yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael puts his hand under Letty's chin and draws her he up so he can look into her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Promise you won't fall for any guys pretending to be doctors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty shakes her head "no" as tears stream down her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I should go now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty stands up and walks toward the door. She comes back and embraces Michael again. Slowly, they separate, and Le leaves the room. Michael stares out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty walks out the door, down the steps and along the fr walkway -- until, finally, the hospital recedes in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty sits on top of a desk. Children of all ages stare h down. A few familiar faces--Bobby and Jenny--grace the ro Principal Gail passes outside the window and glances in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First of all, I want to welcome you to MathShop. I have lots of fun games planned for us. (beat) Let's see, Bobby, can you help me pass out these cards?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby doesn't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is something wrong, Bobby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why were you gone so long?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mom said you went crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had what some people call a nervous breakdown. I wasn't dealing with life so well so I went...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To a place for psychos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To a psychiatric institution.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a place where you figure out what you want, and what things in your life aren't working. You learn to look out for yourself and not get...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty trails off. She sees that she's lost the class. Bob launches a spit wad that hits the boy in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me show you the best thing I learned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks up to Bobby. He twists around in his seat, tryi to hide the rest of his supply of spit wads. Letty waves her hand around Bobby's head. The children, stare, delighted. She pulls a bright coin out of his ear, and hands it to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow./ Neat./ Do it again, Miss Mayer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letty puts her hands behind her back and produces a bouqu of paper flowers. Now, she's got the class hooked.
